sponsor.partnerMessage: Bowen Dental Studio is a dental office unlike anything you've experienced. Their patients receive personalized, compassionate care from one of the most highly-skilled dentists in the area. They prioritize listening to and caring for their patients. Learn more here.

posts.title: Feature: Heirloom at 1907
posts.content:
Have you heard of the practically hidden restaurant within the 1907 building in Rogers? 

  • Fine dining: It’s called Heirloom, and you can find it “near the hand holding the guiding light.” It is a 20 seat restaurant that serves a multi-course prefix dinner to reservations only. Reservation slots a month ahead open at 11a on the 15th of every month. 
  • Plan ahead: Due to popular demand and 2020 cancellations getting first dibs on January, you’ll have to join a waitlist (which is used frequently) for this next month. As 2022 progresses, the Heirloom staff says availability will increase. 

For more about Heirloom, click HERE.

posts.title: Fresh Grass Festival Coming 2022
posts.photoCredit: Edward C Robison, courtesy of the Momentary
posts.content:
This past fall the Fresh Grass Festival was a huge success out at The Momentary, and it is set to return this spring. 

  • Back again: The celebrated music festival will be at the Momentary on May 20-21, 2022 for 2 days of family friendly bluegrass and roots music. Performances will be on multiple stages across the Momentary accompanied by activities for all ages. 
  • Line-up: Headlining artists will be announced in the coming months, but tickets for the general public go on sale Monday, Dec.20. Early bird tickets go on sale today at 10a. 

Stay tuned for more info HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas Airports Get Funding
posts.content:
As a result of the Airport Infrastructure Grant program, Arkansas airports will receive $23m in the first round of funding. Around $6m will go toward Northwest Arkansas airports.

  • Local aviation: The Northwest Arkansas National Airport (XNA), Bentonville Municipal, Springdale Municipal, Drake Field, and Rogers Executive will all receive funds, which can be invested in practically any project.
  • Include: The Federal Aviation Administration encourages airports to use the funds for projects that increase airport safety, equity and sustainability, and plans to reach out to minority businesses for these opportunities. 

Read the full Talk Business & Politics story HERE.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Good morning, and welcome back to Friday! Here are some things to do this weekend:

  • Shop and hang: You're sure to find something wonderful at The Market at Record on Saturday from 9a-noon.
  • Fun run: The Jingle Bell jog at the Botanical Gardens in Fayetteville is tomorrow.
  • Singin': Go out to your favorite place and hear some local talent play live music.
  • Comedy: You could possibly hear the best joke ever tonight at Bike Rack.
  • Play: The Best Christmas Pageant Ever is showing all weekend.
  • Ballet: Today and Tomorrow the sugar plum fairy, the snow queen, and the nutcracker prince are back.
  • Celebrate: The Core Brewery Taproom is hosting a Christmas party tonight, and you're invited.

Have fun! Happy Holidays, and bye for now!

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Reasons to move: If you need to convince your friends to move here, send them this.
  • Team Musselman: Who doesn't love a good backstory?
  • Progress: Fayetteville's art and design district is underway.
  • Rural development: The Gravette Fire Department came into some grant money recently.
  • For kids: Arkansas's linebacker is doing a shirt sale for adoption and foster care.
  • Planning: Let's be in touch about getting you in the newsletter first thing next year.
